intro: Hopkirkia eupatoria, commonly known as the common hopkirk, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in grasslands and open woodlands. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are characteristic of the daisy family. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Hopkirkia eupatoria is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
